intro: Thlaspi rubescens, commonly known as red root sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, blooming in early summer. Its leaves are alternate, fleshy, and often covered in a waxy coating, which helps it retain moisture in arid environments. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
